Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE
Name: Bowl
Description: A bowl with a wide mouth, a rim that thickens towards the exterior and with moulding below the lip. The body has straight flared walls and a stable base with ring-shaped foot. The paste is orangey in colour. The exterior surface is rough, the interior surface and the outer rim have a reddish-coloured coating which is partially lost.
